results.title: Pottery ladies. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Jenny Wilkes, Elizabeth Taylor-Mead and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: Joan Jackson (Rhead’s biographer), Gordon Elliot (ceramic historian), Barry Leigh (manufacturer) and the women employed in the manufacturing process of Rhead’s work discuss and trace the history, influences and production techniques of Charlotte Rhead’s work.

results.title: 26 Bathrooms
results.brief_description: Peter Greenaway uses visual imagery to present this warm and humorous look at people and their bathrooms, revealing that the bathroom is used for far more than the daily duties of cleanliness and hygiene. We see people soaking, dozing, eating, reading, chatting and watching television in surroundings that range from plain porcelain to the “Samuel Beckett Memorial Bathroom”.

results.title: Cane toads: an unnatural history
results.creator_credit: Mark Lewis, Tristram Miall and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Bufo Marinus, the cane toad, was introduced into Queensland in 1935 for a specific reason - to combat the grey-back beetle that was destroying the sugar cane crop. The mission failed : the beetle could fly and the cane toad couldn’t. Oblivious of its failure, the cane toad settled extremely well into its new surroundings and proceeded to breed so rapidly that it has now become a pest of plague proportions. This amusing documentary blends biological fact with human comment to show how the cane toads have become an accepted part of local culture and popular mythology.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Lewis, Tristram Miall and Film Australia

results.title: The Business plan
results.creator_credit: Paul Humfress, Geoffrey Barnes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: To succeed in an ever-increasing technologically oriented world, a business plan is needed. This provides the parameters for basic planning and acts as a stimulant for the viewer to ask the right questions and seek the right answers in an authentic business environment. It is of particular interest to owner/managers of small manufacturing businesses.

results.title: Moon man
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel, Zdenka Deitchova, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This animated story, based on the picture book by Tomi Ungerer, tells of the Moon Man, bored with a lonely life on the moon, who wants to join in the fun on earth, and what happens when he does.

results.title: Joey runs away
results.creator_credit: Daniel Ivanick, Paul R. Gagne and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Joey, a young kangaroo, tired of his mother’s complaints about his messy room in her pouch, decides to run away. While Joey searches for a new home, word gets around that his mother has an empty room. What follows will entertain children of all ages. Based on the book by Jack Kent.

results.title: They found a cave
results.creator_credit: Andrew Steane, Charles E. Wolnizer and Australian Council for Children's Film and Television
results.brief_description: They found a cave: Four English orphans migrate to Tasmania under the care of their Aunt. Their Aunt becomes sick and is hospitalised, leaving the children to seek refuge in a secret cave. Excitement follows the children as they face danger and adventure in the rugged terrain before they are finally reunited with their Aunt. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.

results.title: I Can jump puddles = I'm jumping over puddles again
results.creator_credit: Karel Kachyna and Filmove Studio Barrandov
results.brief_description: This award winning film, based on Alan Marshall’s heartwarming book, has transferred the setting from the Australian outback to a huge stud farm in the picturesque countryside of Moravia, a part of the Austro-Hungarian Empire at the turn of the century. Adam, the energetic son of a horse trainer contracts polio and is hospitalised. He is still determined, however, to fulfil his constant dream of riding a horse, and he persuades his friends to help him in secret. Czech language with English sub-titles. Not suitable for children.

results.title: Play School. the All Together Show; at the Zoo
results.brief_description: The “All together show” is a delightful compilation of well known Play school songs and stories produced by seven well loved Play school presenters - Benita Collings, John Hambelin, Noni Hazelhurst, Jan Kinsbury, Alistair Smart, Don Spencer and John Waters. In “At the zoo” Play school visits Sydney’s Taronga Zoo. Jan Kinsbury, Elaine Hudson and Don Spencer look at the monkeys, chimpanzees, giraffes, lions and seals, as well as a rabbit, a turtle, a baby kangaroo and the animals at the Zoo’s Friendship farm.

results.title: The Massage Tape: Your Magic Touch (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Catherine McEwan demonstrates three different massage techniques - head, back and feet massage. Ms McEwan has done a lot to give credibility to the term “remedial” massage in Australia. She has studied many branches of alternative medicine and currently teaches in NSW. This tape is a must for tension relief. Rated: G.
